clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of ARPE Prosthesis With the Literature
clinical_study.official_title: Trapezia-metacarpal Arthroplasty: Comparison of ARPE Prosthesis With the Literature

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metacarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objective is to compare functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metarcarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition. Literature values obtained by a recently published meta analysis1 will be used.
Secondary objectives are:
- to compare functional outcome at 1 and at 5 years after trapezio-metarcarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition
- to determine pre- and postop HR QOL
- Incidence of RLL at each follow up time point. Literature values from the same meta analysis1 will be used.

primary_outcome.description: Functional outcome: hand function, strength (grip, key pinch & tip pinch)

secondary_outcome.description: Pain level collected on a horizontal line, rated from 0 (no pain) to 100 (very severe pain)
- functional outcomes at 1 and 5 years follow up after trapezio-metacarpal arthroplasty / trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with LRTI.
- ROM (palmar and radial abduction)at 1, 3 & 5 years follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life determined by the EQ-5D score
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D is a standardized instrument for measuring health status. It is made up for two components. The description part: health status is measured in five dimensions (5D); mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Mobility dimension asks about the person's walking ability. Self-care dimension asks about the ability to wash or dress by oneself. Usual activities dimension measures performance in "work, study, housework, family or leisure activities". In pain/discomfort dimension, it asks how much pain or discomfort they have. In anxiety/depression dimension, it asks how anxious or depressed they are. Visual analogue scale: The patient marks his health status on the day of the interview on a 20 cm vertical scale with end points of 0 and 100. The bottom rate (0) corresponds to " the worst health you can imagine", and the highest rate (100) corresponds to "the best health you can imagine".
- Incidence of Radiolucency lines at 1, 3 & 5 years follow-up

study_pop.textblock: patients with trapezio-metacarpal arthritis Eaton Stage of trapezio-metacarpal arthritis : Stage II - IV

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with trapezio-metacarpal arthritis Eaton Stage of trapezio-metacarpal arthritis : Stage II - IV
- willing to return for follow up evaluation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- local or systemic infections
- severe muscular, neurological or vascular deficiencies of the extremity involved
- bone destruction or poor bone to affect implant stability
- allergy to any of the components of the implant
